task_completion.name: Task Completion
task_completion.description: Whether the agent successfully completed the goal and achieved the correct final state

scoring_guidelines.10: Task completed successfully with all goal conditions met
scoring_guidelines.5: Task partially completed or missing some conditions
scoring_guidelines.0: Task not completed or completed incorrectly

examples.good: Agent correctly placed clean apple in refrigerator as specified
examples.poor: Agent placed apple in wrong location or failed to clean it first

task_completion.prompt_template: Did the agent achieve the goal state? Consider: Was the correct object found? Was it transformed correctly (cleaned/heated/cooled)? Was it placed in the correct location? Score 10 if fully successful, 0 if failed.

efficiency.name: Efficiency
efficiency.description: Steps used relative to step budget, minimal wasted actions

scoring_guidelines.9-10: Efficient path, minimal steps, no wasted actions
scoring_guidelines.7-8: Efficient path with minor detours, few unnecessary actions
scoring_guidelines.5-6: Moderate wandering, some backtracking or repeated actions
scoring_guidelines.1-2: Severe inefficiency, majority of steps are wasted

examples.good: 7 steps to complete task with no wasted moves
examples.poor: 40 steps with multiple visits to same locations

efficiency.prompt_template: Score efficiency based on steps used vs budget. Consider: step_ratio = steps_used / 50. Score roughly as: <20% = 9-10, 20-40% = 7-8, 40-60% = 5-6, 60-80% = 3-4, >80% = 1-2. Penalize repeated identical actions and unnecessary 'look' commands.

strategy_quality.name: Strategy Quality
strategy_quality.description: How sensible, prioritized, and adaptive the agent's action sequence is

9-10: Checks high-probability locations first (countertops, tables for visible items; cabinets/drawers for stored items)
Clear subgoal decomposition: find object → pick up → transform if needed → navigate to target → place
Adapts quickly when object not found in expected location
7-8: Occasional inefficient choices but trajectory stays focused
5-6: Systematic but poorly prioritized search (e.g., checks cabinets before countertops)
3-4: Frequently revisits same locations without progress
Following a shallow or generic plan

examples.good: For 'put apple in fridge': checks countertop → finds apple → picks up → goes to fridge → opens → puts
examples.poor: Wanders through all rooms, opens every container, picks up wrong objects, forgets to pick up before placing

strategy_quality.prompt_template: Score strategy quality 1-10. Consider: (1) Did the agent check likely locations first? Countertops/tables before cabinets/drawers for visible items. (2) Did it minimize backtracking and revisits? (3) Did it complete subtasks in correct order (find→pick→transform→place)? (4) Did it adapt when objects weren't where expected? Cite 2-3 specific steps that justify your score.

reasoning_quality.name: Reasoning Quality
reasoning_quality.description: How coherent, goal-aware, and observation-grounded the agent's explanations are

9-10: Explicitly references the goal and explains how each action contributes
Reasoning is grounded in current observation (mentions objects/locations actually seen)
Adapts explanation when encountering unexpected results
Shows awareness of task structure and remaining subgoals
7-8: Reasoning aligns with actions most of the time
Minor generic statements but overall coherent
5-6: Reasoning is coherent but shallow or repetitive
Limited adaptation when things don't go as expected
Often restates observations without deeper insight
3-4: Reasoning is generic or mismatched to environment
1-2: Reasoning contradicts observations or hallucinates objects
Does not mention goal at all
No alignment between reasoning and action

examples.good: I need to find a mug. The countertop is a likely location for mugs. I see countertop 1 mentioned, so I'll check there first.
examples.poor: I will explore the environment. Let me look around. I should examine things.

reasoning_quality.prompt_template: Score reasoning quality 1-10. Consider: (1) Does the agent mention the specific goal object and target? (2) Does it reference what it actually observes? (3) Does it explain WHY it chose each action? (4) Does it adapt reasoning when actions fail or yield unexpected results? (5) Is reasoning unique per step or copy-pasted? Quote 1-2 reasoning snippets that justify your score.

patterns.name: stuck_loop
patterns.description: Agent repeats the same action 3+ times consecutively

patterns.name: wrong_order
patterns.description: Agent tries to place object before picking it up

patterns.name: target_confusion
patterns.description: Agent places object in wrong location

patterns.name: object_confusion
patterns.description: Agent picks up wrong object type

patterns.name: excessive_exploration
patterns.description: Agent visits 10+ locations without finding target object
